title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, [30 january 1873]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [30 January 1873]
text: 30 Jan 73My dear darling waltWaltI have just got your letter i am glad my dear waltWalt you are as well as you are i know its bad enoughfenough to be confined in your room and unable to walk but i am glad to hear your friends is so kind i thought of peter i knew if it was in his power to be with you he would and cherefullycheerfully doodo everything that he could for you) i could wish you was here walter dear but as it cantcan't be so i trust you will be restored to your usual health and your dear old mother i am about as i was when you was here the cold weather dontdon't affect me so very much) good bie walterWalter dear remember me to peterwrite just as you are walterWalterdontdon't say you are better than you are god bless you my sonthursdayThursday afternoon 30th Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [30 January 1873]
